{"step_by_step_thinking": "This question is asking about features that Suganti Devi may present with due to idiopathic cholestasis during her 30th week of pregnancy. Idiopathic cholestasis is a liver disorder characterized by elevated levels of bile acids in the bloodstream, which can cause pruritus and jaundice. Pregnant women with idiopathic cholestasis often have abnormal liver function tests, including elevated serum bilirubin, alkaline phosphatase, and transaminases (SGPT). Prothrombin time is also commonly prolonged in these patients. The key to answering this question is to identify the features that are most characteristic of idiopathic cholestasis during pregnancy.", "answer_choice": "A"}
